SHORT_DESCR.P: The contract is for the supply of all Hand Sanitiser, Hand Moisturisers, Hand Wash, Anti-bacterial hand wash and systems to all entities constituted pursuant to the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978, (i.e. all NHS Scotland Health Boards, Special Health Boards and the Authority) together with independent contractors to NHS Scotland such as dentists, general medical practitioners, pharmacists, opticians etc.
We envisage awarding 8 suppliers to this Lot.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The option to extend by 1 x 12 month period.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Liquid and/or foam hand wash products to be used in all clinical settings.
We envisage awarding 8 suppliers to this Lot.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option to extend by 1 x 12 month period.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Anti-bacterial hand wash to be used in catering facilities.
We envisage awarding 8 suppliers to this Lot.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option to extend by 1 x 12 month period.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Where products from Lot 1 (hand Sanitiser), Lot 2 (Hand Moisturiser) and Lot 3 (Hand Wash) are used in conjunction for maximum benefit.
We envisage awarding 8 suppliers to this Lot.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The option to extend by 1 x 12 month period.

MAIN_SITE.P: To and or all Locations of NHS Scotland Health Boards, all NHS Scotland Special Boards and/or the Authority.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Alcohol hand rub to be used in all clinical settings.
We envisage we will award 8 suppliers to this Lot.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option to extend for 1 x 12 month period.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:

1) all candidates will be required to provide a statement, covering the 3 previous financial years including the overall turnover of the candidate and the turnover in respect of the activities which are of a similar type to the subject matter of this Notice;
2) all candidates will be required to provide statements of accounts or extracts from those accounts relating to their business.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:

1) all candidates will be required to provide certification drawn up by an independent body attesting the compliance of the economic operator with quality assurance standards based on the relevant European standards;

2) certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to specifications or standards;
3) samples, descriptions and/or photographs, the authenticity of which must be certified if the Contracting Authority so requests;

4) a statement of the principal goods sold or services provided by the supplier or the services provider in the past 3 years, detailing the dates on which the goods were sold or the services provided, the consideration received, the identity of the person to whom the goods were sold or the services were provided.

Bidders are required to provide evidence to show that all products are Manufactured to EN:ISO9001:2008 or equivalent Bidders are required to evidence that each product is fully traceable by lot / batch number to the manufacturer.
Bidders are required to provide the stated minimum range of products which fulfill the basket of goods for each applicable lot in the ITT document.

Bidders are required to evidence that the Hand Hygiene products and services are or have been in use by health care customers. Accordingly potential framework participants must submit with their tenders.
A statement of goods provided in the last 3 years and:
i) the value of the contracts;
ii) the identity of (a minimum of 2 healthcare customers) persons to whom the goods were sold or the services were provided, including address, phone and email.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
Lot one (1) Hand Sanitiser:
These should be free from methylisothiazolinone (or MI/MIT) or methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI) or combinations of both.
It is a requirement that alcohol hand Sanitiser products contain minimum 70% alcohol.
All Hand Sanitiser products must be manufactured to comply with BSEN1500.
The required Hand Sanitiser must be either Gel, Foam or Liquid.
Tendered products are required to be Fragrance free / unperfumed.
Accessories are important for these products.
Please confirm that a full range of accessories are available. These should include clips, brackets and dispensers) as appropriate.
It is a requirement that Bidders must offer a Tamper Proof Pump Option (Bed / Wall) for alcohol hand Sanitisers.
Lot two (2) Hand Moisturiser:
These should be free from methylisothiazolinone (or MI/MIT) or methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI) or combinations of both.
Please confirm that your tendered moisturiser is a water based product and not based on some other substance such as oil.
Tendered products are required to be Fragrance free / unperfumed.
Lot three (3) Hand Wash:
Please confirm the products are free from methylisothiazolinone (or MI/MIT) or methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI) or combinations of both.
Please confirm the products are free from benzylkonium chloride.
It is a requirement that tendered Hand Wash products are manufactured to comply with BSEN1499.
It is a requirement that tendered products are Liquid or Foam.
Tendered products are required to be Fragrance free / unperfumed.
Lot four (4) Anti-bacterial Hand Wash:
Please confirm the products are free from methylisothiazolinone (or MI/MIT) or methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI) or combinations of both.
Please confirm the products are free from benzylkonium chloride.
It is a requirement that tendered Anti-bacterial Hand Wash products are manufactured to comply with BSEN1499.
It is a requirement that tendered products are Liquid or Foam.
Tendered products are required to be Fragrance free / unperfumed.
Lot five (5) Systems — this is as above.

A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:
Background (from Scottish Government — Scottish Procurement Policy Note 6/2014 20.11.2014).

— the Scottish Model of Procurement aims to secure the maximum economic benefit from the 10 000 000 000 UK GBP spent by the public sector on goods and services each year, through an approach that balances the business friendly and the socially responsible,

— the Public Procurement Reform Programme delivers value that goes beyond savings and benefits — improving supplier access to public contracts, particularly for SMEs, maximising efficiency and collaboration and placing the local, social and economic aspects of sustainability at the heart of the purchasing process,

— the Procurement Reform (Scotland) Act 2014 has established a national legislative framework for sustainable public procurement that supports Scotland’s economic growth through improved procurement practice — and requires public bodies to consider how their procurement activity can improve the economic, social and environmental well-being of the Authority’s area,

— it also specifically requires public bodies to consider imposing community benefit requirements as part of a major contract; these might relate to, for example, employment opportunities or to sub-contracting opportunities,

— prior to secondary legislation being introduced to implement the provisions of the Act and the transposition of the three new EU Procurement Directives, maximising the impact of Scotland’s procurement spending will remain front and centre in our considerations.
